title: Jharkhand accident: Bus carrying Kanwariyas collides with truck; BJP MP says 18 dead
content: A tragic accident in Jharkhand's Deoghar district claimed the lives of at least 18 Kanwariyas early Tuesday morning. The bus carrying pilgrims collided with a truck near Jamuniya forest, leaving several others injured. Authorities have been alerted, and efforts are underway to provide medical assistance to the injured, with concerns that the death toll may rise.

title: 'Used furniture to block door': Witnesses recall terrifying moments during Manhattan shooting
content: A shooting in Midtown Manhattan resulted in the deaths of five people, including a police officer and the suspected gunman, Shane Tamura. The incident occurred inside an office building, reportedly housing Blackstone investment company, causing widespread panic as the shooter moved floor by floor. Police have contained the scene, confirming the shooter is dead, while investigations are underway.

title: Denied chance to speak on Op Sindoor, Manish Tewari shares 'Bharat ki baat' post
content: ​While sharing a news article on why Congress did not allow party MPs Shashi Tharoor and Tewari to speak in Lok Sabha, the Congress MP posted famous lyrics of the Hindi film "Poorab and Pashchim". "Hai preet jahaan ki reet sada, Main geet wahaan ke gaata hoon, Bharat ka rehne waala hoon,  Bharat ki baat sunata hoon," Tewari said in a post on X, adding, "Jai Hind."

title: Wankhede Stadium heist: IPL jerseys worth Rs 6.5L stolen from BCCI office; security guard held
content: A security guard at the BCCI office in Mumbai has been arrested for allegedly stealing 261 IPL jerseys, valued at Rs 6.52 lakh. Farooque Aslam Khan, the accused, reportedly sold the jerseys to an online dealer to fund his online gambling addiction.

title: Delhi weather update: Heavy rain lashes capital; Air India warns of flight disruptions
content: Heavy rainfall lashed Delhi and the NCR region on Tuesday, causing widespread waterlogging and disrupting traffic during peak hours. The downpour, accompanied by thunderstorms and gusty winds, stranded commuters and affected flight operations, prompting advisories from Air India and Delhi Airport. The IMD forecasts continued rainfall, urging residents to stay alert.

title: Accenture executive says AI can speed up work, but won’t raise productivity unless…
content: Artificial Intelligence tools can speed up tasks. However, Accenture's Ramine Tinati says it doesn't guarantee productivity. Companies need to redesign workflows for real gains. Some Asian firms are lagging in AI adoption. Tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft are investing heavily in AI. Nvidia's Jensen Huang and OpenAI's Sam Altman believe AI will change jobs.

title: Tensions escalate at Sona BLW: Cease-and-desist notice issued to Rani Kapur
content: Sona BLW Precision Forgings has issued a cease-and-desist notice to Rani Kapur, Sunjay Kapur's mother, over alleged defamatory information. The company refutes her claims of mismanagement and coercion, highlighting its professional management and independent board. Rani Kapur, who isn't a shareholder, plans to respond legally, while the company emphasizes transparency and adherence to corporate governance post-Sunjay's death.

title: India playing XI: Kuldeep in the mix, Akash Deep likely to return; call on Bumrah soon
content: With the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy still alive and series on the line, India are expected to veer from its safety-first approach in the fifth Test, starting Thursday at The Oval, and go all-out for the kill to level the series. Bumrah's participation remains uncertain and the question marks over Shardul Thakur or Kuldeep Yadav persists. On the batting front, Dhruv Jurel replaces the injured Rishabh Pant.

title: Chinese company banned in America launches rival to Nvidia’s most-advanced chip
content: Huawei's CloudMatrix 384, showcased at WAIC Shanghai, is emerging as a strong competitor to Nvidia's GB200 NVL72. Despite U.S. restrictions, Huawei is becoming a key Chinese AI chip supplier. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang acknowledged Huawei's progress and warned about the impact of U.S. curbs, suggesting Huawei could dominate if restrictions persist.

title: Gold price prediction: Where are gold rates headed ahead of US tariff deadline?
content: Gold price prediction: Gold prices are fluctuating within a range due to decreased demand for safe-haven assets as global economic uncertainties lessen with trade deals. The US-EU trade agreement, while criticized by some, has reduced market uncertainty. Investors are closely watching US-China trade talks and the upcoming FOMC decision for further direction, with a slightly bearish outlook for gold in the near term.

title: IND vs ENG: The swordsman vs The showman – Jadeja or Stokes, who stands taller?
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series highlights the contrasting yet compelling rivalry between Ben Stokes and Ravindra Jadeja. While Stokes is celebrated for his match-winning performances in high-pressure situations, Jadeja's consistent all-round contributions often go unnoticed. Despite Stokes' impactful bowling in the series, Jadeja's superior batting and overall value have sparked debate about who is the better all-rounder.

title: NFL headquarters shooting: Police respond to shocking shooter rampage in Midtown Manhattan
content: A mass shooting at 345 Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, home to the NFL headquarters and other major firms, left five dead, including a police officer. The alleged gunman, Shane Devon Tamura, 27, of Las Vegas, used an AR-15-style rifle before fatally shooting himself. The incident has sparked concerns about gun control and security in high-profile urban buildings.

title: Microsoft employees react to CEO Satya Nadella's memo: Is he feeling guilty about... or…
content: Microsoft employees are reportedly skeptical of CEO Satya Nadella's memo addressing recent layoffs amidst substantial profits and AI investments. The company has eliminated around 15,000 positions this year, despite a $75 billion profit over three fiscal quarters.

title: Himachal rain fury: Mandi flash flood kills 3; Chandigarh–Manali highway blocked
content: A flash flood in Mandi town, triggered by a cloudburst, has claimed at least three lives and caused extensive damage to houses and vehicles. The Chandigarh-Manali highway is blocked due to landslides, exacerbating the situation. Rescue operations are underway as authorities assess the full extent of the devastation, with one person still missing.

title: Hit and run: Thar driver reverses to target elderly after minor collision in Jammu; flees
content: In Jammu, a young man, Manan Anand, has been booked for allegedly hitting an elderly man after their vehicles collided. CCTV footage shows Anand driving recklessly before the initial collision, after which he intentionally reversed his Mahindra Thar to strike the victim again near Allora Textiles.

title: Chess | The banana survives in Batumi; India gets its first-ever Women's World Cup champion in Divya Deshmukh
content: In a historic win at Batumi, Georgia, 19-year-old Divya Deshmukh clinched India's first-ever Women’s World Cup chess title, defeating Grandmaster Koneru Humpy. The intense final saw Divya, playing with black pieces, triumph in a rapid tie-break. Amidst the drama, an untouched banana served as her quirky companion, a constant presence throughout her victorious journey.

title: Engineer jumps to death from Pune office building; leaves heartbreaking note
content: In Pune, a 23-year-old mechanical engineer died after jumping from his office building. The incident happened in Hinjewadi. The engineer worked for a technology company. Police recovered a note from the body. The note suggested personal struggles. He was from Nashik and had been working at the company for a year.

title: US may axe OPT, threatening Indian students: Can America’s tech sector absorb shock? What it means
content: A Republican-led bill, H.R. 2315, aims to eliminate the OPT programme, jeopardising post-study work rights for international students—especially Indians, who dominate STEM-OPT participation. Critics call it a “job theft” loophole, but data shows OPT fuels U.S. innovation, university funding, and tech firms. Killing it could gut America’s global talent pipeline—and its competitive edge.

title: 'At Lord's, the same happened' - Nasser Hussain reveals how Stokes fires up Archer
content: England captain Ben Stokes' leadership, especially his handling of Jofra Archer, has garnered praise amidst the ongoing Test series against India. Former skipper Nasser Hussain highlighted the trust and chemistry between Stokes and Archer, noting Stokes' ability to motivate Archer effectively. The final Test vs India starts on July 31.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 80,900
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was near 24,700, BSE Sensex was hovering near 80,900.

title: 'Within less than a day ...': Trump reveals how he 'settled' Thailand-Cambodia standoff
content: Donald Trump claimed credit for brokering peace between Cambodia and Thailand by leveraging trade deals. He stated discussions led to a quick resolution, preventing further conflict. Trump warned both nations that trade negotiations hinged on ceasing hostilities. Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet thanked Trump for his support, while a ceasefire was declared after Malaysian-mediated talks.

title: Who was Shane Tamura? What we know about the Manhattan building shooter
content: A tragic shooting at a Midtown Manhattan office building on Park Avenue resulted in five fatalities, including an NYPD officer and the suspected gunman, Shane Tamura. Tamura, armed with an AR-15-style rifle, opened fire in the building's lobby before taking his own life.

title: Bengaluru techie honeytrapped: Gang extorts Rs 2L on drug charge; 'MDMA' turns out to be baking soda
content: Yelahanka police arrested a gang of six, including a woman, for allegedly extorting Rs 2 lakh from a techie in a honeytrap scheme. The woman befriended the victim on a dating app before luring him to a house where the gang accused him of drug use.

title: Zach Evans retires at 24: Early NFL exit caps career earnings under $1M; Former Jets RB walks away despite promise
content: Zach Evans, a promising sixth-round pick in the 2023 NFL Draft, has retired at 24 with only $920,832 in career earnings. Drafted by the Rams, he later joined the Jets but ultimately stepped away from the league before training camp. His early exit highlights the financial uncertainties of short-lived professional sports careers, despite a promising college performance.

title: 'Most influential of last decade': Former IND head coach Ravi Shastri singles out ex-India captain
content: Ravi Shastri has praised Virat Kohli, calling him the most influential player of the last decade. Shastri, the former India head coach, made the statement in a recent video on X. He also named Jasprit Bumrah as the bowler he'd least like to face. Shastri reminisced about his career, highlighting his World Cup win.

title: NEP@5: More learners, more women, more languages - But can it deliver on its full promise?
content: India's National Education Policy 2020 is showing promising early results, particularly in foundational learning for primary students, where reading and arithmetic skills have seen significant gains, especially in rural areas. Higher education is also experiencing growth, with increased enrollment across various demographics, including women and marginalized communities. However, the policy faces implementation challenges and political resistance, hindering the widespread adoption of some reforms.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Draw was the goal': Dale Steyn hits out at Jadeja, Sundar for 'free milestones'
content: The drawn fourth Test between India and England at Old Trafford saw late-game drama as Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar opted to continue batting despite a handshake offer from Ben Stokes and Harry Brook. Dale Steyn weighed in, suggesting a handshake would have been sportsmanlike once the draw was secured, though he acknowledged the batters' right to pursue milestones.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Mallika Sherawat to participate in the reality show?
content: An actress has officially denied her participation in Bigg Boss, putting an end to swirling rumors. Despite a past guest appearance, she clarified she will never be a contestant. While some fans expressed disappointment, others appreciated her directness. The show's new promo has sparked excitement, fueling speculation about potential contestants like Dheeraj Dhoopar and Munmun Dutta.

title: Terrorist who led Pahalgam attack killed in J&K gunfight
content: Indian Army para commandos neutralized Suleiman, the lead perpetrator of the Pahalgam massacre where 26 civilians were killed. The operation, named 'Mahadev', took place in the Dachigam forest area near Srinagar, resulting in the deaths of two more Pakistani terrorists linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba. Suleiman, a former Pakistani special forces commando, was also involved in the 2023 Poonch attack on an Army truck.

title: 'This plea shouldn’t have been filed': SC to Varma
content: The Supreme Court questioned Justice Yashwant Varma's petition challenging the in-house inquiry into the discovery of currency at his residence, noting his participation in the process. The court highlighted that the inquiry report wouldn't be binding on the Lok Sabha's inquiry panel. Additionally, the bench addressed a plea for an FIR against Justice Varma, requesting the inquiry report for review.

title: London stabbing near Tower bridge: Two dead, two injured including suspect; no terror link suspected
content: A stabbing incident in Southwark, central London, near Tower Bridge resulted in the deaths of two men, aged 58 and 27. A man in his 30s was arrested but is in critical condition, while another man sustained non-life-threatening injuries and is hospitalized.

title: Amid Bihar’s SIR drive, dog gets residence certificate; oppn roasts EC, Nitish govt
content: In Bihar, a residence certificate was fraudulently issued to a dog named 'Dog Babu,' raising concerns about the integrity of the state's e-governance systems during the special intensive revision of electoral rolls. The incident, involving misused Aadhaar details, has sparked outrage from the opposition, who allege widespread irregularities in the voter roll revision process. Officials are facing action for negligence in verifying the application.

title: In LS, Rajnath, Jaishankar reject Trump mediation claim as Cong's Gogoi flags it
content: In Lok Sabha, the government refuted opposition claims that Operation Sindoor was halted due to US pressure, as alleged by President Trump. Rajnath Singh and S Jaishankar clarified that Pakistan initiated the truce after India achieved its objectives. They emphasized that trade was never linked to the operation in discussions with the US, dismissing the allegations as baseless.

title: ‘Saiyaara': Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda starrer inches closer to Rs 260 crore in India despite a drop
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara' continues its strong box office performance into its second week, earning ₹9.50 crore on Monday, bringing its total to ₹256.75 crore in India. Despite a weekday dip, the film has outperformed major Bollywood releases like 'Dunki' and 'Singham Again'.

title: Manhattan: Five people, including a police officer, killed in shooting incident; suspect neutralised
content: A major shooting in Midtown Manhattan on Monday evening left an NYPD officer and two civilians wounded. A lone gunman opened fire near a corporate building on Park Avenue before being neutralised. The shooter is believed to be dead. One civilian is in critical condition, while the officer and another civilian are expected to survive.

title: Ryne Sandberg dies at 65: Chicago Cubs legend battled cancer; MLB world mourns Hall of Famer’s loss
content: Baseball legend Ryne Sandberg, affectionately known as “Ryno,” passed away at 65 after battling metastatic prostate cancer. A Chicago Cubs icon, Sandberg starred for over a decade, earning 10 All-Star selections and the 1984 NL MVP award. His Hall of Fame induction in 2005 cemented his legacy. Sandberg's impact extended beyond the field, coaching and inspiring future generations.

title: Maharashtra bars staff from online criticism of government
content: The Maharashtra government has issued guidelines restricting state employees' social media use, prohibiting criticism of current or future government policies. Employees are barred from sharing confidential documents without approval and must avoid banned websites and apps. Violations will result in disciplinary action under the Maharashtra Civil Services Rules, emphasizing responsible online conduct and separation of personal and official accounts.

title: Atlanta inventor Julian Brown 'missing' for two weeks; his last post triggers suspense
content: Julian Brown, a young inventor from Atlanta, has reportedly disappeared after posting a message about being under attack. Brown is known for 'Plastoline,' a plastic-to-fuel technology. His last social media post hinted at trouble. Social media users expressed concerns about his safety and urged the FBI to investigate. His followers claim that something bad happened to him as he did not post on social media after July 9.

title: US scientists find that lifestyle changes like diet, exercise can help reduce dementia risk
content: A recent study, involving over 2,100 adults, reveals that consistent lifestyle changes significantly improve cognitive function in older adults. Participants who followed a structured program with coaching, exercise, and a brain-friendly diet showed noticeable improvements in mental sharpness. This highlights the importance of structured interventions for maintaining cognitive health as we age, as opposed to self-guided approaches.

title: SIR in Bihar: Accept Aadhaar along with voter ID, SC tells EC
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar and EPIC for voter authentication during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. The court emphasized that the SIR should focus on broad inclusion rather than exclusion. While rejecting a stay on the SIR, the court agreed to daily hearings for a swift resolution.

title: From September 2, US visa interview waiver only in special cases
content: The US has tightened its non-immigrant visa norms, requiring in-person interviews for most applicants, including those under 14 and over 79, starting September 2nd. Exceptions exist for B-1, B-2, B1/B2 visa renewals within 12 months of expiration, provided certain criteria are met. Consular officers retain the right to mandate interviews on a case-by-case basis, impacting wait times which vary across Indian cities.

title: Tom Brady backs son’s hoop dreams: Hints Michigan recruitment after viral dunk video
content: Tom Brady, now retired, is proudly showcasing his children's talents, particularly his son Benjamin's basketball skills, even hinting at a future Wolverine. While Benjamin explores both football and his artistic side, Brady's eldest, Jack, is also making his mark in sports, strengthening their bond. Brady embraces his children's diverse interests, supporting their individual paths.

title: Rajnath Singh: Operation Sindoor achieved objective, was then 'paused'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh defended Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha, stating its objective was to punish Pakistan for proxy terrorism by eliminating terror nurseries, and it was paused after achieving desired results, not due to US pressure. The opposition criticized the government for halting the operation and demanded accountability for security lapses in Pahalgam and clarification on downed Indian jets, questioning the operation's success and the delay in reclaiming PoK.

title: Killing of terrorist who led Pahalgam strike blunts opposition's attack in House
content: Just before the Operation Sindoor debate, the killing of three alleged terrorists near Srinagar, including Suleiman, the suspected mastermind of the Pahalgam massacre, seemingly deflated the opposition's planned criticism of the government's counterterrorism efforts. Despite this development, SP's Ramashankar Rajbhar questioned the delay in arresting those responsible for the Pahalgam attack, even as BJP's Baijyant Panda celebrated the news of Suleiman's death during Operation Mahadev.

title: LA Lakers add Villanova’s 6-foot-8 all-time scorer to support Luka-LeBron power duo
content: Los Angeles Lakers have signed Eric Dixon, Villanova's top scorer, along with RJ Davis, Arthur Kaluma, and Augustas Marčiulionis. Dixon's signing was delayed due to a foot injury. He is known for his scoring ability. The Lakers aim to build depth around LeBron James and Luka Doncic. Dixon may start in the G-League.

title: 'Just a top-shelf human being': Teammates, opponents remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: Cubs Hall of Famer Sandberg dies at age 65
content: Ryne Sandberg, a Hall of Fame second baseman who spent nearly all of his playing career with the Cubs, died Monday after a recurrence of cancer.

title: 4 killed in shooting at NYC tower housing NFL HQ
content: Four people, including an off-duty NYPD officer, were killed and another person was critically wounded in a shooting Monday at a midtown Manhattan building that houses the NFL offices and some of the country's top financial firms, authorities said.

title: 'It was a no-brainer': Paul celebrated in L.A. return
content: Eight years after he last played for the franchise, Chris Paul was reintroduced as a member of the Clippers on Monday, calling his return to Los Angeles a "no-brainer."

title: D-backs 3B Suárez hit on hand, X-rays negative
content: D-backs All-Star Eugenio Suárez hopes he avoided a major injury when he was hit on the right index finger by a pitch on Monday.

title: Deion says he's cancer-free after bladder removal
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Raiders player offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Source: Dallas' Guyton (knee) out, but ACL intact
content: An MRI revealed that Cowboys left tackle Tyler Guyton suffered a bone fracture -- not a torn ACL -- in his right knee during Monday's practice. He will sit out four to six weeks, but the injury will not require surgery.

title: 💍 Haliburton proposes to girlfriend Jade Jones
content: Haliburton staged the proposal inside Hilton Coliseum on the Iowa State campus, where the couple began dating.

title: Updated ranking of MLB's top 50 trade deadline candidates: New names added
content: Our running list of who could be traded has some big changes in the final few days before the July 31 deadline.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Why Mets could trade Vientos
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the WNBA trade deadline.

title: Who will start for the Browns and Colts in Week 1? We made QB battle predictions
content: We talked to sources to help project open QB1 races in Cleveland, Indianapolis, New Orleans and New York.

title: Can Ashton Jeanty deliver on the hype? Those who've watched his career have no doubt
content: Ashton Jeanty started turning heads as a 14-year-old in Naples, Italy. His coaches, teammates and even his opponents have been witnesses to his rise.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Pérez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo Pérez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Refreshed as Manchester United begin their U.S. preseason tour, Ruben Amorim finally has the time to implement the changes he feels will turn the club around.

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: Late heroics, Reggie the dog and a new team mantra. Here's the inside story of how England won the 2025 European Championship.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Alexander Isak amid a summer of big spending isn't about being better this season but about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: TCS's 12,000 job cuts spark fears of larger IT layoffs

title: Nimisha Priya case: Death sentence in Yemen not overturned? Govt says information 'inaccurate'
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Three killed, one missing as flash flood wreaks havoc in Himachal's Mandi
content: The Chandigarh-Manali National Highway has been closed at 4 Mile, 9 Mile and Dwada as the road stretches have been washed away.

title: Lucknow Court grants custody of Chhangur baba to Enforcement Directorate for five days
content: Chhangur Baba and three other people were arrested by the U.P. Police’s Anti-Terrorism Squad on July 5

title: A.P. CM Chandrababu Naidu proposes training and innovation partnership with ‘AI Singapore’
content: ‘Empowering our students with emerging technologies like AI is not just an investment in skills, but a foundation for long-term innovation and economic growth,’ says CM Chandrababu Naidu

title: Five Kanwariyas killed, 23 injured in bus-truck collision in Jharkhand
content: The accident occurred near the Jamuniya forest under the Mohanpur Police Station limits around 4.30 am when the bus collided with the vehicle

title: Andhra Pradesh government signs MoU to set up Creator Academy
content: The MoU was formalised in the presence of Andhra Pradesh Minister for Education, IT, and Electronics, Nara Lokesh, during a special event held in Singapore on Tuesday (January 29, 2025).

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends names for judgeship in six High Courts
content: The three-member collegium meeting headed by Chief Justice B.R. Gavai approved the proposal for appointment of judicial officer Vimal Kumar Yadav as a judge of the Delhi High Court

title: Supreme Court hearing on Presidential Reference LIVE: CJI says the Bench will fix up the timelines
content: The States of Tamil Nadu and Kerala have argued for the return of the Reference. They termed it as “misleading” and an “appeal in disguise”

title: PM’s ‘shameful silence’ on Israel’s assault on people of Gaza height of ‘moral cowardice’, says Sonia Gandhi
content: Congress parliamentary party chairperson Sonia Gandhi slammed the Modi government for being a "mute spectator to this affront to humanity", and said this was a "cowardly betrayal of our constitutional values".

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 7 LIVE: PM Modi and HM Amit Shah to speak on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha
content: Centre will table  the Report of the Comptroller and Auditor General of India on Inventory Management in Steel Authority of India Limited in Rajya Sabha

title: Nimisha Priya case: Information shared by certain individuals are inaccurate, says MEA
content: On July 28, 2025, office of Sunni leader Kanthapuram A.P. Aboobacker Musliar claimed that the execution has been revoked by the Houthi militia

title: Rain might have washed it away, says Meghalaya Minister after 4,000 tonnes of coal go missing
content: The High Court has directed the State government to take action against officials under whose watch the coal went missing.

title: What is Maharashtra’s new security Bill? | Explained
content: What does the Maharashtra Special Public Security Bill entail? How does it propose to counter ‘urban Naxals’? Which other States have similar laws? Which party opposed the Bill in the State’s Legislative Assembly? What are the main objections being raised against the Bill by civil rights activists?

title: TGCHE leads English curriculum revision on NEP 2020 lines
content: The revision will focus on less content, but with clear concepts and useful skills, or “light but tight” idea

title: ‘Every city in the country needs a HYDRAA’
content: One year on, the Hyderabad Disaster Response & Asset Protection Agency’s bulldozer image has masked a larger mission to reclaim lakes, restore public trust and reshape Hyderabad’s urban future. The institution’s chief defends tough crackdowns, explains legal strategy and outlines why demolition is just one part of the bigger picture

title: Anakaputhur, a former weavers’ colony, now on the verge of development
content: The famous Real Madras Handkerchief, Bleeding Madras and Madras Checks came from the handlooms of this village near Pallavaram

title: India has world’s highest number of slum clusters in flood-prone areas
content: A new study has found that more than 158 million slum-dwellers in India live in vulnerable settlements in floodplains, with most of them concentrated in the Ganga river delta

title: Magnitude 6.5 earthquake hits Nicobar Islands, no tsunami alert
content: The quake struck at a depth of 10 kilometres at 12 minutes past midnight local time, 259 kilometers west-northwest of Sabang, in western Indonesia’s Aceh

title: Haridwar stampede: Pushkar Singh Dhami directs to form a high-level committee for crowd management at Uttarakhand shrines
content: Chief Minister also stressed that the committee must work on minute details like studying the carrying capacity of the shrines and even nearby areas

title: Beed sarpanch murder case: Court rejects Walmik Karad’s discharge plea
content: The prosecution in the court argued that accused Walmik Karad conspired with co-accused persons, demanding a ransom of ₹2 crores from the officials of the company Avaada Energy Private Ltd

title: NSCN faction says Assam eviction drive planned to grab Naga ancestral lands
content: The outfit says the areas targeted were fictitiously marked ‘disturbed area belt’, citing demarcations by the British, who transferred these areas for administrative convenience

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) delegation meets Governor, demands removal of ‘corrupt’ Ministers
content: The delegation submitted a memorandum to the governor, underlining several incidents of misconduct by Ministers in the State Cabinet and provided evidence

title: Ceasefire between India and Pakistan had no linkage with U.S. trade: Jaishankar in Parliament
content: There was no call between the Prime Minister and President Trump from April 22 – when President Trump called up to convey his sympathy – and June 17, says Jaishankar

title: DMK has failed in its duty and surrendered to the BJP: Vijay
content: He says the Centre has sidelined Tamil Nadu, but now Prime Minister Narendra Modi is announcing statues for Chola kings and “taking lessons” from the Chola dynasty

title: Mamata asks migrants harassed in other States to return to West Bengal
content: Earlier in the day, during an administrative meeting West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee proposed to include migrant workers who returned to the state after 100 days of work under MGNREGA

title: Set for a record: paddy procurement in Tamil Nadu likely to touch 45-lakh-tonne mark soon
content: As of now, 44.49 lakh tonnes have been procured. With the State procuring an average of about 15,000 tonnes from farmers on a daily basis, the current high of 44.95 lakh tonnes, collected in 2020-21, will be crossed in a few days

title: Trump Calls London Mayor "Nasty Person" In Front Of UK PM, He Reacts
content: US President Donald Trump attacked London's Mayor Sadiq Khan once again at a news conference in Scotland alongside British Prime Minister Keir Starmer, who interjected that Khan was his "friend".

title: "Bharat Ki Baat...": After Shashi Tharoor, Another MP's Message To Congress
content: As the Congress tries to corner the Narendra Modi government during the ongoing Operation Sindoor debate, its internal strains are making headlines and putting the main Opposition on a sticky wicket.

title: Heavy Rain In Delhi, Multiple Flight Operations Disrupted
content: Heavy rainfall accompanied by thunderstorms affected several regions of Delhi, providing a respite from the prevailing humid weather conditions on Tuesday morning.

title: Video: Spanish EF-18 Hornet Jet Nearly Crashes Into Crowd During Airshow
content: A Spanish Air Force EF-18 Hornet fighter jet had a close call after it appeared to lose control and crash during an airshow at a crowded beach in Gijon over the weekend.

title: "Don't Know What Happened To My Son, I Need Closure": Sunjay Kapur's Mother
content: Rani Kapur--former Chairperson of Sona Comstar and mother of the late Sunjay Kapur has spoken publicly for the first time since her son's untimely death in London.

title: An Immigrant From Bangladesh Turns Out To Be A Hero For New Yorkers
content: Didarul Islam, 36, a brave officer with the New York Police Department (NYPD), was shot at by a 27-year-old gunman with a mental health history at a Midtown Manhattan office building early this morning.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 7 Live Updates: Union Home Minister Amit Shah To Address Lok Sabha On Op Sindoor
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will open 16-hour long special discussion on the Operation Sindoor in the Rajya Sabha today.

title: "Proud To Be President Of Peace": Trump On Thailand-Cambodia Ceasefire
content: US President Donald Trump touted his role in the Cambodia-Thailand ceasefire, saying that he has instructed his team to restart trade negotiations with the two south-east Asian nations.

title: Most Phones Sold In US Are Now Made In India: Report
content: India has overtaken China to become the top source of smartphones sold in the US, after Apple Inc. shifted to assemble more of its iPhones in the South Asian country.

title: Vijayawada Metro Rail Project: Tenders Invited For Phase 1 Construction
content: The Andhra Pradesh Metro Rail Corporation (APMRC) has officially invited Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) tenders for the ambitious Vijayawada Metro Rail Project Phase 1.

title: Who Was Shane Tamura, The Gunman Behind Deadly Manhattan Building Shooting
content: Shane Tamura held a concealed firearms permit. It was issued to him on June 14, 2022, and was valid for five years.

title: How Office Furniture Shielded Employees During New York Shooting
content: At least five people, including a police officer and a suspected gunman, were dead following a shooting at a skyscraper in central Manhattan in New York on Monday.

title: "Reminded Me Of 9/11": Witness On New York Office Building Shooting
content: Four people, including an NYPD officer, were killed after a gunman opened fire inside a midtown Manhattan office building on Monday evening (local time).

title: 4 Killed In Shooting At New York City Office Building, Suspect Dead
content: At least four people were reportedly killed, including a New York Police Department officer, in a shooting in New York's central Manhattan on Monday (local time).

title: "My Conscience Does Not Allow Me To Watch India vs Pak Match": Asaduddin Owaisi
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has joined the opposition clamour against the upcoming India-Pakistan match, voicing his discomfort with watching the Asia Cup match scheduled to be played five months after the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Two Stabbed To Death Near Tower Bridge In Central London: Cops
content: Two men were stabbed to death at a business in central London on Monday near Tower Bridge, British police said, a major tourist destination and an area where violent crime is rare.

title: Assam To Clear 3,300 Acres Of Encroached Land Amid Mega Eviction Drive
content: The Himanta Biswa Sarma-led government is now planning to launch a massive eviction drive in upper Assam's Golaghat. The move will clear 10,000 bighas (approximately 3,300 acres) of land in the Rengma Reserve forest at Uriamghat, bordering Nagaland.

title: Trump-Kim Jong Un Ties "Not Bad", US Must Accept New Nuke Reality: North Korea
content: -North Korea said on Tuesday the United States must accept that reality has changed since the countries' summit meetings in the past, and no future dialogue would end its nuclear programme, state media KCNA reported.

title: IT Employee Hacked To Death In Suspected Honour Killing In Tamil Nadu: Cops
content: An IT employee belonging to the Scheduled Caste was hacked to death by a youth, allegedly over an inter-caste relationship, police said on Monday.

title: 2 People Shot At Manhattan Office Building In New York City, Suspect Dead
content: Police swarmed Midtown Manhattan on Monday as the mayor of New York City said there was "an active shooter investigation" amid reports a police officer had been struck.

title: Yemen revokes Nimisha Priya’s death sentence, claims Kanthapuram
content: Indian official sources, however, refused to confirm the claim so far saying the case is complex as the victim’s family had not reached a consensus on pardoning Nimisha Priya

title: Bus fare subsidy helps women save 30-50% on transport costs, increase edu spending: Study
content: The report revealed that in cities such as Nagpur and Pune, where fare subsidies apply primarily to intercity or long-distance routes, average monthly savings range from ₹409 to ₹538

title: Namma Metro opens new gate at Majestic for direct access to KSRTC outstation buses
content: This is part of BMRCL’s larger initiative to boost last-mile connectivity and enable seamless multi-modal transport integration in Bengaluru

title: Farmers in Punjab stage demonstration under KMM banner against Govt’s land pooling policy; Akali Dal also protests
content: Shiromani Akali Dal members staged a protest rally in Mohali against the land pooling policy. The party announced to hold another demonstration rally in Bathinda on August 4

title: Nuns are innocent, say family members of tribal women
content: Arrest of Keralite nuns in Chhattisgarh trigger protests; siblings of the purported victims reject allegations of trafficking and forcible conversion; they say the tribal women were accompanying the nuns to Agra for a job with the consent of family members; Chhattisgarh Chief Minister defends arrest

title: CS instructs officials not to appoint teachers to revise voters’ list
content: Shalini Rajneesh has instructed officials to appoint non-teaching staff, officers, and staff members working in various departments on priority basis for the task of revising the voters’ list

title: India, Japan officials meet, discuss PM’s visit, bullet train project
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is expected to visit India for the Quad Summit, along with U.S. President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, later this year

title: State sees a fall in seroprevalence of Hepatitis B, says nodal officer
content: World Hepatitis Day is observed on July 28 to raise awareness on the liver infection caused by five types of viruses A, B, C, D and E; sex workers, drug users and those who get tattoos are generally considered to be at higher risk

title: Centre should abandon security-centric approach, engage in dialogue to resolve J&K issues: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Speaking at the PDP’s 26th foundation day event, she says Centre should restore trust of the people by engaging in a process that respects their dignity and rights

title: Google officials depose before ED in online betting linked PMLA case
content: The agency may also record the statement of a designated "compliance officer" of Google under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) apart from obtaining some documents from the company

title: Nuns to stay, serve in Gaza despite attacks, says Missionaries of Charity
content: The Missionaries of Charity has served in multiple conflict zones in the world, including in Gaza; the organisation said that the nuns “have been there from the beginning of the conflict”

title: Only by acknowledging diversity can India progress, says D. Raja
content: Releasing the book Kaalamthorum Communists, he urges communists to work closely with Periyarists and Ambedkarists to liberate people from exploitation and inequality

title: LJP(RV) will continue in the NDA, says senior party leader and MP Arun Bharti
content: Mr. Bharti’s remarks come in the backdrop of party President Chirag Paswan’s critical comments against the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar

title: Congress sources say Shashi Tharoor opted out of debate on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha
content: BJP member Baijant Panda claims Mr. Tharoor was not allowed to speak by his party as he spoke in “national interest”

title: Mamata Banerjee ‘reminds’ officials they work for the State not ECI
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister directed officials to ensure that not a single name is removed from the voters list and that people should not be harassed

title: Kamra, Andhare deny charges in reply to breach of privilege notice
content: While Shiv Sena UBT leader Sushma Andhare asked how is ‘gaddar’ (traitor) an unparliamentary word, Kunal Kamra said the term has been used while targeting politicians during ‘heated’ exchanges

title: Why did Justice Varma submit to in-house inquiry if it was contrary to Constitution, Supreme Court asks
content: The query came after senior advocate Kapil Sibal complained that the action taken by the Supreme Court at the time, including release of sensitive visual and audio materials showing ‘burnt currency’, “convicted” Justice Varma in the public eye

title: Private defence suppliers seek review of rules limiting ammunition procurement to public sector
content: A private defence manufacturer says if the MoD amends the existing rule to allow for open Request For Proposal to be issued to both public and private sector, it will provide a big boost to the private ammunition industry

title: Procedure to redress chemically contaminated sites gets legal teeth
content: The new rules are part of a process of “legally codifying” the process in place once contaminated sites were identified; under these rules, the district administration would prepare half-yearly reports on “suspected contaminated sites”

title: BRS, Sigachi victims’ kin flay delay in handing over bodies, ex-gratia
content: Harish Rao asks why details of total deaths, injured persons not announced even after a month of the mishap

title: Congress raises questions on security lapses which led to Pahalgam attack
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi asks govt. to clarify claims made by U.S. President Trump that he used trade to bring about truce between India and Pakistan; Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee says no country supported India during the conflict

title:
Will Modi speak in North India about 
Rajendra Chola’s victorious expedition, asks  TNCC chief Selvaperunthagai
content: The TNCC president dares Mr. Modi to speak about installing a statue for Rajendra Chola in North India and the defeat he had meted out to the north Indian armies during his expedition

title: BJP MPs protest against Muslim cleric’s remarks on Samajwadi Party leader Dimple Yadav
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi, the cleric, had criticised Ms. Yadav, wife of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, for visiting a mosque near the Parliament without covering her head

title: Three months after SC order, West Bengal government yet to pay DA dues of employees
content: DA arrears, unemployment and lack of jobs trigger fresh unrest in State; heavy police deployment fails to deter marchers

title: NIA submits reports on Jiribam killings, Manipur HC gives one month to file chargesheet
content: Last month, the court had said that it had been a considerable time since the incident and yet no chargesheet had been filed in the case in which six persons were abducted and later found dead

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Nusa, Fofana if Rodrygo move fails
content: former chelsea striker is expected to make a move to the red Devils . he scored eight goals in 16 Serie A matts for the club . the bianconeri are now expected to advance the deal to avoid it being hijacked . click here for more transfer news .

title: Euro 2025 Talking Points: Best match, goal, player, Team of the Tournament
content: the Lionesses are back-to-back champions, but which players made a name for themselves on the biggest stage? Emily Keogh, Tom Hamilton, Beth Lindop, Julien Laurens and Sam Marsden have been on the ground in Switzerland this summer .

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Gonzalez goes down for Pats
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: Brock Purdy and wife, Jenna, announce birth of first child
content: Purdy's wife, Jenna, gave birth to the couple's first child, millie Joleen . the 49ers' new arrival came nearly two weeks after star running back Christian McCaffrey and his wife had their first child .
